website_summaries.verdict: The Ryka Devotion is a walking shoe that achieved top marks from consumers for being lightweight, comfortable, cushioned, and supportive. The product also alleviated foot pain from plantar fasciitis and other conditions. However, the shoe received a significant chunk of critiques about its lack of durability. The reviewers also lambasted its small and narrow fit and insufficient arch support. But on the whole, a majority of buyers were satisfied with the comfort and quality of the product.
pros: The Ryka Devotion delivered comfort during long walks, according to plenty of reviewers
Many testers were impressed by the plush cushioning for its shock-absorbing properties
Fitness enthusiasts thought the shoe was also suitable for high-impact fitness classes
Various buyers were pleased with the support that the footwear provided
A handful of people complimented its lightweight nature
The trainer relieved the pain caused by plantar fasciitis and other foot and joint conditions, as noted by some of the users
cons: A majority of the detractors lamented the product’s low-quality materials
there were reports of worn-out treads, flattened cushioning, and torn upper
Most critics were disappointed with its small and narrow fit
Numerous wearers found its arch support to be lacking
A small number of purchasers felt discomfort while wearing the trainer

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this Brand. I bought my first pair 3 1/2 years ago because my feet got bigger right after pregancy. They are so comfortable and support my feet so well. I have tried on other brands but NONE are a cushiony as Ryka. By the way, I exercise and walk a lot, almost 5 miles per day. My old pair has taken a beating and held up well! I would recommend these to everyone. Wish more stores carried Ryka!
customer_reviews.author: Butterflysoul

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this shoe. I had such high hopes based on the high reviews. I am 5'7", plus size and work in retail. I am on my feet for 8 hrs a day, concrete floors. I am battling plantar fasciitis. The first few days with these shoes were great. Felt like I was stepping on a pillow. I wore them everyday to work for two weeks and it feels like all the padding and support has disappeared/worn out. My feet were aching bad. Was hoping for a better shoe for $60. Going back to kswiss.
customer_reviews.author: Christian R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love Ryka walking shoes. I have worn them for many years and many mikes. I am only walking about 12-15 miles per week now, but used to walk 20-25. My feet have taken the beaten with plantars fasiatis and stress fractures. Ryka has the narrow hill and wider footbed. Best for our feet. This style is wonderful, however, I did exchange for half size larger than my size I have always worn. Fit is perfect and feels so good on my walk. The price has come down over the years. Women are missing out who do not wear Rykas. They designed for US.
customer_reviews.author: MISSISSIPPI PROUD

customer_reviews.title: When I first got these shoes I loved them, they are very comfortable but in just ...
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these shoes I loved them, they are very comfortable but in just a few months they are already falling apart. The bottom of the shoes is splitting and I'm sure it won't be long before they are split in half. I don't know if they are 2nds but I will never buy another pair of Ryka shoes, I have Nike's that are 7 years old in better shape! I don't walk that much so it's not from wear and tear. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Nana

customer_reviews.title: Became uncomfortable after an hour.
customer_reviews.text: They seemed comfortable at first, then I walked around the house for about an hour and a half doing laundry and chores. After about an hour and a half the balls of my feet started to hurt, the insole seems pretty thin. I'm not sure what the issue is, but they're not the right shoe for me. I tried the wide and they had plenty of wiggle room for my toes but seemed to for like a regular shoe everywhere else. I really liked the toe box on these.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 1/2 size larger = perfect
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying shoes so for me to leave a 5-star review on shoes should say something. I bought these 1/2 size larger because I used the printable ruler from the manufacturer's website which suggested a size 10 instead of my normal 9.5. For the first few days of break-in they felt like they got tighter through the day and my feet were sore about 3 hours in. Now they are just fine. I did notice they get a little slick when wet. They fit perfect and I will buy them again. Matter of fact, I am looking to see if they have any hiking shoes in this same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ve

customer_reviews.title: The Pink is not Pink!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the lighter gray of this sneaker with the turquoise accents and loved the way they felt so much that I had to order a new pair. I decided to go with the darker gray, that seemed to be accented in pink - I should have paid attention to another reviewers note that the pink is really almost a neon orange. The sneaker still feels wonderful and is comfortable right from the start, but anyone choosing this color should be aware that the picture is not accurate. For me, the orange just doesn't match any of my clothes!! I kept them, but wish I had gone with the turquoise again.
customer_reviews.author: Math Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not a good support
customer_reviews.text: Bought these sneakers as Ryka is usually a very good sneaker. I loved the way they looked. Wore them one day at work and on my feet all day. My back hurt so bad from such a bad support sneaker. I had to return them hoping on finding a better sneaker with better support
customer_reviews.author: janis

customer_reviews.title: Work well with my bad knees
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I had surgery on both knees for torn meniscus. There are very few shoes I can wear without being in pain. With the RYKAs I can walk long enough to go grocery shopping and run a few errands before my knees start to really bother me. I'll be having TKR in two months, but in the meantime I'll stick with my RYKAs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: left shoe not same as right
customer_reviews.text: pretty looking. i wanted these to work so badly but the left shoe had a huge ankle area so kept slipping, despite numerous tries at re-lacing in different ways. The right shoe was so tight at top of foot was difficult to get my foot into shoe. also the tongue on these is way too long and sticks out at least 1.5", oddly rubbing your leg whennu move. On inside where tongue is attached it is roughly sewn seam bumps up which painfully rubs and irritates top of foot. strange fit and sewing problems.
customer_reviews.author: GirlBerry

customer_reviews.title: Devoted to Ryka Devotion!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that I know that all feet are different and so what works for me won't work for everyone. But I have to say that with my arthritis and plantar fasciitis, I'm always on the lookout for good shoes. I haven't found any other sneaker with the same level of support, cushion, and shock absorption that works for my feet. Usually I have upgrade the insoles but not with these. I have tried on the Devotion Plus and was disappointed that there was nothing "plus" about them. I'm so in love with the Devotions that I'm stocking up on them and getting rid of my other sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy V.

customer_reviews.title: These shoes DONT disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shoe that would be wide enough and a larger toebox because one of my feet is bigger than the other due to arthritis. The shoes did not disappoint. I can wear them all day and have perfect support and relief for my foot. I would definitely recommend them. They arrived before scheduled delivery time
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Too small sent back
customer_reviews.text: Quality Construction. Love black purple blue combo. Liked everything bout shoe except it was too small! I normally am either a size 9.5 or 10... Ordered a different pair of rykas last week that were a size 10 and They were too big; so I ordered these ryka s in size 9.5 and they too small! Therefore, disappointed that these did Not fit! Just now went to purchase these in size 10 but they are $80.00; That is $31.00 more Than the 9.5 I just returned! Won't give into price gauging!
customer_reviews.author: wolfaleena

customer_reviews.title: Love these... Found my new brand!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I've been having an issue with my feet hurting & these eliminated much of that pain. I used to buy Asics because they looked the best & fit well but the support I needed wasn't there. I'm a 9-1/2 & most tend to be tight or too big. These Ryka shoes fit perfectly. They are stylish, fun & more importantly are comfortable! I found my new brand!
customer_reviews.author: debi1977

customer_reviews.title: 9W - Very wide padded heel really great everywhere else
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes. They are so bright and colorful, very hot pink. They were super comfortable everywhere except the heel. It is super padded, which isn't necessarily a bad thing. But either these were made wrong, or designed wrong, or are just for women with a more wide heel. I couldn't tighten them enough to keep the heel from slipping with every step and as comfortable as they were everywhere else, there was just no way I could keep them. I was really sad to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: StoneHenge

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: My first clue should have been the too short shoe laces. That's usually a sign of cheaply made athletic shoes, but, I bought longer laces and gave them a try. These shoes have ZERO support! It felt like I was walking on my ankles. Within just one block, the pain in my hips, back, and knees was so bad I had to turn around and go home.
customer_reviews.author: DHH

customer_reviews.title: and are pretty comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews, I ordered a size 7 though I normally wear a size 6.5. They fit me perfectly, and are pretty comfortable right out of the box. I've worn them daily for over a month and they are still comfortable, though I will be changing the insert per my doctor's suggestion to provide better support. I have somewhat narrow feet, and the toebox has just enough room. Someone with wider feet may prefer the wide sizing or to go up by a full size.
customer_reviews.author: Skye T.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - the most comfortable walking shoes I've found!
customer_reviews.text: My mother-in-law walks every day, but started having hip issues (she had some of those old-style "rocker" walking shoes). I'd already owned a couple pair of Ryka Devotions and loved them, so I ordered a pair for her. She started wearing the Rykas, and her hip pain went away within a couple of days! They are amazing! TIP: Order at least 1/2 size up (they do run a little bit small).
customer_reviews.author: T. Helberg

customer_reviews.title: Already falling apart :(
customer_reviews.text: Soooo disappointed in this purchase. I bought the exact same shoe 5 years ago and they held up GREAT! This pair ALREADY has a hole inside near the heel. Obviously the workmanship on this shoe is not what it use to be.
customer_reviews.author: HELGA DEYO

customer_reviews.title: a well padded sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I am familiar with Rykas line of sneakers. They run a wee bit narrow. I was a medium and they were perfect but due the aging process I am now a wide. I tried other makes and they were way too wide. Ryka wide is perfect. Now for this particular shoe. It is well padded, as I have certain pressure points that are painful, and the arch support is superior. You can feel the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Vangogh

customer_reviews.title: My 10th (or More) pair!!
customer_reviews.text: Ryka, for women only. These are the only shoes I have worn for nursing for the past 6 years. I go through a pair every 3 months--on my feet 12 hrs a day, 4 days a week. I keep 2 pair going and alternate. The sole is built with little air filled pillows on the bottom for support and comfort and they have never leaked or gone flat. There is great inside support for higher arches. LOVE these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BLT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cross trainer
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fitness professional and I love Ryka cross trainers. These have great cushioning in heel strike and the ball of foot. I teach HIIT style workouts and strength training classes. This shoes also provides excellent lateral support as the movements go side to side as well as front and back. The Devotion has come a long way from its original debut years ago. Great shoe I continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mme

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Aerobic Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing one form of aerobic exercise for twenty years. I do Zumba, and jazzercise wearing the devotion. I don't know why these are always referred to as walking shoe. It gives me great support, the fit is right on and the ball of the foot has great cushion, often lacking in other shoes. I don't understand why aerobic shoe designers don't understand how important that is in high impact aerobics. I am probably on my 15th pair. I replace them every four months,sometimes three. Ryka please don't mess up a good thing. Do not stop making these.
customer_reviews.author: N. A

customer_reviews.title: Hard to break in these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid walker with distances of 5 to 7.5 miles a day. This shoe has been problematic from the start with heel blisters. The heel box broke down during the second time I put them on to walk and I had to use a spoon to push it back up. I was not standing on the heel to push them on either. The good part about this shoe is the sole is extremely soft and comfortable but the heel issues out weigh the great sole.
customer_reviews.author: Mollieisms

customer_reviews.title: LOVE them. Plenty of room in the body of ...
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my review. Loved this shoe in the beginning. I am by no means an avid walker. Not enough to have had this shoe break down like it has. The bottoms of the shoe have not lasted long. And the comfort is no longer evident in this shoe. Sad, I was pretty excited. This shoe delivered just as the reviews said it would! LOVE them. Plenty of room in the body of the shoe. First time in a long time not having sore toes when my walk is done. And comfort the first time wearing. Will definitely be doing this shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: K Park

customer_reviews.title: No support, could never break them in, and are falling apart after two months
customer_reviews.text: After two months of almost daily wearing, these shoes never quite broke in. Even now they are still rubbing against my heels and now the inside padding on one of the heels is coming apart. I am going to have to get a new set of athletic shoes already. In addition, these shoes have little to no cushion or support. Walking in them would always give me painful shins splints after just a few minutes. I found some mild relief when I got myself some inserts. Finally, the shoe laces these came with were too short. I ended up having to get new laces just for these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money somewhere else
customer_reviews.text: These might be the worst shoes I have ever purchased. SO uncomfortable its like having 2 inch blocks of concrete strapped very tightly to my feet. Almost like high heeled shoes but look like sneakers. The arch support pains my feet so bad my legs and hips hurt and I can't keep the shoes on for more than a couple hours max, which makes going to work very difficult. They're also made out of cheap materials and there is some kind of foam on the inside above the hole where your toes go that poke into my toes every step I take. Don't waste your money on these shoes like I did. Terrible shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Good sneaker fo a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Ryka Devotion sneakers for several years. They fit my foot perfectly. I wear a women’s size 10 B. I do put my own orthotics in them as I need a more rugged arch support. This pair fit as expected. They give the right amount of toe room. The later versions changed the shape of the toe which causes the shoe to run short.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M.

customer_reviews.title: Needed a Wide - Was Defective
customer_reviews.text: 4 Stars for comfort though this shoe ran a little tight for me in width. I normally wear a regular width shoe/boot. 3 Stars because it arrived defective - a bonded side support wasn't bonded (none of the side supports are sewn) to the shoe's surface. It could be very gently pulled away from the mesh outer shell of the shoe to reveal a place where two pieces of mesh fabric met and were not secured. I did not feel confident that the shoe would hold-up well so did not order a replacement in the wide size.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes—but have a strange odor after a while
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Very comfortable from the start. I have wide, arthritic feet with a high instep and these shoes fit perfectly. I wish the shoelaces were a little longer, but that is the only issue. I do a lot of walking and these work perfectly. Update: I changed the shoelaces to ones you don’t need to tie, so that helped. The biggest problem with these shoes is that they stink inside. I always wear socks with them, have washed them, etc but I can’t keep them in my closet because they stink so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Lee

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair about 3 years back and for some reason they developed a smell I could not get rid of - even by washing a few times. Very weird. I looked online as I wanted exact same shoe again and I found it - in a snappy new color that I love. Fit was perfect and they look great
customer_reviews.author: Julie M. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Despite what some reviewers said, I ordered my usual size 9 medium, and they're a perfect fit. I walk 3-4 miles on an asphalt path 5-6 times a week. These shoes may be the most comfortable walkers I've ever had. I should mention that I've only worn them for a couple of days, so I can't speak to how well they'll wear. So far, so good, especially considering the price. I've had these shoes for 3 months, walking 20 miles a week on an asphalt path. Couldn't be happier with them. The price has gone up about $20 since I bought them--wish I'd bought 2 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! The comfort is awesome - like made for my feet and I love the lightness of them ... like I can fly! Through the years, have worn a variety of walking and running shoes and these surprised me. For the price, the quality is higher than far more expensive shoes ... the only drawback (which is common to most walking shoes) is they are slippery when wet. Five star though!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Not what they seem
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be super comfortable because of how it felt initially. I've worn them for a week hoping to break them in. They have caused the ball of my foot to seize up and my knee to be thrown out of whack. I am going back to.the Sky Walk model.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe. Love Ryka Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Ryka fan, and this shoe doesn’t disappoint. It’s sturdy, yet flexible and comfortable. I think the cushioning and support is just right. I wore them for the first time to an event where I had to do a lot of walking on concrete, and these shoes felt great. And I also love the color of the shoe. The pink and green accents on the gray shoe is not too loud, the shoe looks fashionable, and not boring.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Potts

customer_reviews.title: FAVORITE Workout shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular shoe over 1 1/2 ago and I love them so much that I just bought another pair. I buy workout shoes that I only wear indoors to do my cross-training and cleaning the house. I was so excited to find these on Amazon because RYKA does not make this particular shoe anymore. The other reason I love these shoes so much, is that my big toe is constantly popping up (which makes it uncomfortable to workout) and eventually making a hole. These shoes have enough supported material around the big toe, that I don't have any issues. I do the Cathe Friedrich workouts and these shoes are wonderful for her intense training.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Impressive.
customer_reviews.text: I work in surgery and spend a lot of time on my feet. These shoes are great and the price point is incredible. The seem to have great arch support and the weight of them doesn't make my feet feel like they're weighted down. Glad to have found a brand of shoe that fits well and checks all my boxes!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn Olivia

customer_reviews.title: I can stand on my feet for over 12 hours and hardly any problem,  I add arch support.
customer_reviews.text: this is the second pair I bought. I love this shoe. I wear them sometimes 12 or more hours a day. And with all the problems I have with my legs and feet this shoe causes the least. I will only wear this when I know I will be on my feet for many hours. Lots of support without too much firmness. Lets my toes move easily without feeling like I am barefoot. I do add an arch support because most shoes do not have any.
customer_reviews.author: little kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion and fit
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfy shoe. I wear these as indoor only shoes on tile floors and they are very cushiony since tile is laid on concrete floors which is hard on knees and ankles. These shoes give very good cushion for this. I only by Ryka athletic shoes as they fit a women's foot properly.
customer_reviews.author: Diane P.

customer_reviews.title: Nah
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money, but I can’t find any replacement to my Kayano 20. On my seventh try. Can’t beat gel. These are so not gel. Also, don’t care what I do in these. They require an insole.
customer_reviews.author: K.B.W.

customer_reviews.title: Good looking colors!
customer_reviews.text: I like a sneak that isn't too bold, yet has some color, these are very nice. Comfort is great, but the laces are short and hard to adjust. The quality of the shoe is very good, but not that special. I've worn less expensive shoes that feel the exact same..so I don't believe they are worth $80! Maybe $40, but no more. These are nice sneaks, but not $80 nice, so don't be misled by the price..sometimes you pay too much for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Capricorn54

customer_reviews.title: 4th  pair and will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have had 4 pairs of these shoes. So far they are my favorite Ryka shoe. I have worn rykas since I started jazzercising 7 years ago and these are my favorite. I usually wear them for 3-4 months to class ,6-7 classes a week and then use them for around the house. I think they have good arch support but I have some walkfit inserts that I use because of my mortons nuroma. Will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Ryka shoes several years ago and now only buy this brand. This is the third pair I have purchased and all three have been extremely comfortable, light weight, well built. Ryka only makes shoes for women and it definitely shows. The fit is perfect for a woman's foot. If you have been looking for a good walking shoe, try a Ryka. You won't be disappointed. This color is really pretty also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color of shoe is not what is pictured
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed this is my fifth pair of ryka devotion shoes and I love the way they fit. I have bought them in every color combo however this pair is supposed to be pink and gray and it gets delivered today and it’s bright orange and dark gray. The picture that Amazon showed for the shoe and the box description both say gray and pink
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoes for walking and daily use
customer_reviews.text: I have spine issues and only thing I can do is lots of walking. I've been looking for comfortable walking shoes and since these were rated highest I figured to try them. They are so comfortable best walking shoes I have ever had. True to size (not sure why some said run small). I wear 7.5 and I got 8 and I have little room (I do believe they are wide but doesn't feel that wide). Support and comfort for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Wieczorek

customer_reviews.title: RYKA Women's Devotion Walking Shoe - stylish but VERY comfortable; fit is magical!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of RYKA walking shoes; I wore my 1st pair about 2 years for work (alternating with another brand). I am a nurse, and I have neuropathy from unknown cause. This is by FAR the most comfortable of any of my shoes. Your foot does not slide around, your heel is perfectly cradled and cushioned. I wear between a 9 and 9.5, this shoe I need 9.5. I plan on ordering in more colors to wear even when not at work.
customer_reviews.author: FLSunshineGirl

customer_reviews.title: Comfy shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really love these shoes. I am always hesitant to order shoes off the internet because my feet seem to fit differently with different brands, but these fit perfectly. I have has no issues with these shoes. I really like the amount of cushion in the shoes. I have a job where i walk for 8 hours on concrete, and where other shoes my feet would hurt, these ones i havent had any foot pains. they are really comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: It's not me!
customer_reviews.text: I think my Ryka Devotion shoes are starting to malfunction. Outwardedly, they are in great shape, because I mostly am wearing garden boots. Now my Rykas have begun to pass air with every step, I think from the heel.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Not Too Happy
customer_reviews.text: Listened to the reviews and ordered a half size bigger than my shoe size - fits perfectly! Lots of padding and very comfortable while I'm standing however I've worn them 4 times walking and they make my feet ache! I had to stop several times on my hour walk and stretch my feet! I've even loosened them since I thought they might be too tight but that didn't help! Can't send them back since they're used so I guess I'll just wear them casually and not for walking!
customer_reviews.author: D. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: A Sure Thing
customer_reviews.text: Love these RYKA Walking Shoes! This is my third pair. I walk 16-20 miles a week so I go through shoes. I can put on a new pair of Devotions and walk 4 miles with no issues, no breaking in period and no stiffness. These shoes are designed for women. The heel is narrower than a mens shoe so there is no "slopping" in the heel. The price is right too!
customer_reviews.author: M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Best Ryka shoe I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Rykas since the 1990s and I'm here to tell you these are the best pair I've every owned. For starters, the shoelaces are the right length and they stay tied with one knot! (How long did it take them to figure that out???) The last four pairs I have owned have required my pulling out the provided insoles and replacing them with a gel insole topped with a foam one. I figured these shoes would be the same. Not so! The upper itself is not so roomy that it needs filling up and the foam insoles are actually comfortable and shock-absorbing to support my poor old feet.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel C.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have an achilles problem and the heel support is too stiff on this model; it irritates the tendon. Also, I realize my foot is flattening and I needed a size up. So the rating reflects my personal needs, not the quality of the shoe, which seems very good. Unfortunately, I wore it once, so cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: tried these and they are wonderful. Pain is gone and they feel GREAT
customer_reviews.text: My heels were hurting from my old New Balance sneaks, tried these and they are wonderful. Pain is gone and they feel GREAT! UPDATE: I have now had these sneakers for 2 months. Sad to say they are not very durable. I have 3 places on the bottom sole that have come off, with 3 more loose. Although the fit is beautiful, I need more than 2 months out of a sneaker. If you do a lot of walking, these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: No need to think twice
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Ryka. I was just hoping for a sneaker with a good arch support and it definitely delivered! I love walking around in these. Extremely comfortable. I purchased a half size larger than my normal sneaker size and they fit perfectly. I'd definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Such a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: THIS is my favorite Ryka shoe. I own 4 pair of them. However, the heel fit was very 'short.' They were obviously poorly constructed. I sent them back. They were very prompt in my refund!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect walking shoe for me--comfortable with arch support. Would buy 2-3 pair at a time!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite walking shoe. I'm an avid walker and needed a shoe that would provide long lasting cushioned support (support being the key word), including the perfect amount of arch support. I bought multiple pairs so that when the first pair wear out (which they are long lasting!), I have another waiting for me to slip into! Size-wise, I have a long big toe and like to wear thick athletic socks, so while I usually wear a size 9.5, I bought a size 10 and it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: The best athletic shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Rykas are by far my best athletic shoes! I really like the color of these! The fit is perfect and no other shoes alleviate my plantars fasciitis like these do!
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Best. Sneaker. Ever!
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are amazing and have turned me into a sneaker obsessed person. I want to buy more from Ryka and I will never by another sneaker brand again. They fully support and cushion my feet. I feel like I’m walking on clouds and I didn’t even have to ‘break in’ the shoes. Which blew my mind. I’m officially a loyal Ryka user - for life now.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My feet feel the best in Ryka cross training shoes.
customer_reviews.text: So far these cross training shoes are very comfortable. Even though these are not wide width my feet are not cramped and I do need a wide width for my feet to feel good. The heel of these shoes really hold my heel nice no slipping up and down. I will not buy any other shoe but, Ryka.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie  M. Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Great Arch Support
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Ryka tennis shoes. The heels are narrow for a woman’s foot, great arch support, and an overall great fit. They are so comfortable they’re just about all I wear anytime I’m doing a lot of walking. I do buy a half size large so there is room for my socks. Ryka is definitely made for women, I really like the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Lady

customer_reviews.title: Make sure they are the shoe for you!
customer_reviews.text: Before committing to these shoes make sure you “break them in.” They felt good from the get-go so I jumped right into a walking regimen. Seems they changed the mechanics of my gait and unfortunately have been having to do PT for my muscles ever since 😩
customer_reviews.author: Joanne T.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. My daughter is on her feet for work 9-10 hours per day. She always wears Ryka shoes The color is great and shipping was great even during COVID.
customer_reviews.author: Irisinatl

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with these shoes. They fit as expected and have a lot of room in the toe area. I have wider feet so this is perfect. They are very squishy and have a ton of comfortable rebound. Plus, I really love the color scheme. I feel like they have a lot of stability when I am walking. I really am impressed with them so far!
customer_reviews.author: Goddessofdirt

customer_reviews.title: These are the most comfortable walking shoe on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable walking shoe on the market. I currently have 3 different pairs/different colors, and plan to keep at least 3 on hand at all times to rotate through. They last a while before they wear out. It's like walking on a sponge. Insanely cool. Get the wide though, bigger toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ryka Devotion vs. Ryka Devotion Plus vs. Ryka Devotion Plus 2
customer_reviews.text: After finding a disturbing fit difference between the Devotion Plus and the Devotion Plus 2 (Plus 2 large and "baggy" compared to Devotion Plus) I searched and found the Devotion style available on Amazon for a good price. I suspect that at some point this shoe will no longer be available because it's an older style. However, I was very pleased to find they fit as expected, much like my previous Devotion Plus. I think the difference is the way they're made with sewn on support on the sides of the shoes as opposed to fabric only on the sides of the Devotion Plus 2. Very happy with the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a pair that fit as they should
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair of Ryka's walking shoes that fit as expected. In the past few years, I don't know what has happened to Ryka's shoes? They were not fitting my feet as they did in the past, but now, finally a pair that are. Will be ordering one or more soon so I have them for the future since I walk about 20 miles or more a week.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Henderson

customer_reviews.title: But they are very comfortable and a big improvement over other shoes I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn these a couple times so far. But they are very comfortable and a big improvement over other shoes I've had for walking. I get shin splints when walking far, and these were recommended to alleviate some of that problem. It seems to have very good support in the heel.
customer_reviews.author: C's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous stability and comfortable walking
customer_reviews.text: After I sprained my ankle, I needed a sturdy walking shoe for doing my 10,000 daily steps. I wear this shoe with jeans or dressy black slacks. I replaced the shoelaces because these blue ones were a bit short for my ankle with the ankle brace on. Otherwise, no one can tell I sprained my ankle
customer_reviews.author: Tuner

customer_reviews.title: Great support & comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have high arches & insteps & these shoes feel very cushioned, supportive, & comfy. The back of the shoe's a bit forward so I find it more comfortable to wear socks rather than footies so there's protection in that area. Like most athletic shoes that I've bought, I ordered 1/2 size larger than my dress shoes & these fit well with roominess in the toe area. There's also a great selection of colors. I think these may be my favorite walking shoes ever!
customer_reviews.author: CA Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Too Wide
customer_reviews.text: These are way too wide. I have wide feet and my feet slosh around in these. Also the plastic trim is already peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: TJean

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Ryka and they are just want I wanted for support and durability for general walking. Nice supportive soles for the arches. My only complaint?? The yellow contrast piping is more of a flesh color then yellow but love the shoes anyway. No issues with the size as comfortable and seems true (10M).
customer_reviews.author: KMMT

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I cant say enough about these shoes. So comfortable. I have really bad feet. It took a few weeks to get my feet used to them. Once they did they feel wonderful! I walk up to 7 miles a day at work. They really make the difference! So lightweight and you can feel the rebound from your step in them.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love love love!!!! Wow! For the first time I think I actually found a pear of shoes I can depend on and work with especially being my feet have not been the best with a variety of previous shoes I have purchased! Thanks amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ally R

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the fit and comfort of these shoes. They feel like you’re walking on clouds! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Annis

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing and decided not to order up. It turns out these shoes were too small/Too short - I'm usually a true size 9 & my toes touch the tip of the shoe toe. Also they are too narrow/tight and uncomfortable. I didn't see a wide so I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: jam

customer_reviews.title: These sneakers are EXTREMELY comfortable. I broke my foot last year and as ...
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are EXTREMELY comfortable. I broke my foot last year and as my doctor stated....I also have angry tendons. Because of this I had orthotic inserts made to go in my shoes. I don't have to wear them with these sneakers and my foot doesn't hurt. I highly recommend them. I also like the fact that the toe area is roomy, so no part of the shoe rubs my toe nails when I walk/run.
customer_reviews.author: Schmelle

customer_reviews.title: I continue to be happy with Ryka shoes
customer_reviews.text: I continue to be happy with Ryka shoes. I needed new walking shoes and countless reviews landed me with these and I'm pleased with them. They're attractive and comfortable. My last pair of Rykas lasted for years. I'd like a slightly roomier toe box, but overall am super happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Miller

customer_reviews.title: Bandage your heels!
customer_reviews.text: Put bandages on your heels! With every step your heel slips down into the cushion and then your heel slides up as you step forward. Too much trouble to return, even at that price. Makes you wonder if anyone every actually tries these shoes on before marketing them. But at least these shoes don't have ridiculously long laces. Cute for black shoes but hope you like purple because there is way too much purple that I didn't notice online.
customer_reviews.author: Readsalot

customer_reviews.title: No break in necessary!
customer_reviews.text: Love these Rykas. Very comfortable, nice color and style. Use them for exercise and walking. Never disappointed with Rykas!
customer_reviews.author: dobemom

customer_reviews.title: New color
customer_reviews.text: I really like these walking shoes. Ordered them a couple of years ago and they are still selling them, thanks for the new colors
customer_reviews.author: Bullwinkle

customer_reviews.title: I was wary of switching but needed a new pair and decided to try these based on the good reviews. I have high arches and these h
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size up from my normal shoe size because of other reviews. I was nervous because I almost always wear a size 6 but it was right to order the 6 1/2. I walk a lot on the treadmill and needed new shoes-my previous pair was Saucony. I was wary of switching but needed a new pair and decided to try these based on the good reviews. I have high arches and these have good arch support as well. Would definitely order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what my poor feet needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought another brand and had to return it because they were stiff and hurt. These are just right for my Heel Spur. I would recommend. if you have big feet like me, these are perfect. There is a definite spring in the heel of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lennie

customer_reviews.title: RE-ZORB insole not the same as Ortholite
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes thinking they would be the same as the pair I bought a few years ago - same blue and gray, same styling, but the old ones didn't have orange stripes on the sides. What's lacking in the current shoe is the delightfully comfortable, nicely padded Ortholite insole. The RE-ZORB insole is no where near as comfortable as the Ortholite insole.
customer_reviews.author: Graywings

customer_reviews.title: But they weren't the same and I never forgot the Ryka brand and how I enjoyed working out in them
customer_reviews.text: for many years these were the only shoes I worked out in. As years went by I wasn't able to find rykas in stores so I started wearing other brands. But they weren't the same and I never forgot the Ryka brand and how I enjoyed working out in them. Finally I was working out in a pair of very expensive shoes that caused me serious issues with my ankles and feet. Surfed the web on night and thank God for Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: newmomex2

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoes
customer_reviews.text: I got my new Ryka tennis shoes today and they are very light and fit great. The cushion heal is very nice. I have Plantar fascia and have to have good shoes and these feel good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Stout

customer_reviews.title: They are my go to shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes!! I have had several pairs of RYKA Devotion shoes over the years and all are great. If I wear other shoes, I get really painful heel pain from plantar fasciitis, but because these shoes help prevent the over-pronation (walking out the outside of your feet) I don't have a problem with it. I wear them all day, to the gym, run errands, just about anything and my feet feel supported and comfortable. I also tend to develop blisters on my heels when I get new shoes and that has never happened with a pair of these. I don't know why.
customer_reviews.author: Erin E.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these sneakers. Have been using this specific style & will continue to do so. Have tried several other Ryka styles but they do not offer much needed support. Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Shortyrock

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd Pair of Rykas
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are cute, bright and comfortable. Not my favorite pair, though, because there really is not much arch support for my high arch, but my custom orthotics remedy that. The only thing that bugs me is that the right shoe keeps pulling my footie sports sock down into it. Still working on a fix for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I cannot comment on the durability of this shoe as I just bought it.. however I have had other Ryka shoes in the past and they have held up very well. I love this shoe! It is comfortable and fits perfectly. I have long narrow feet which is the type Ryka is made for. From past purchases I have learned that Ryka runs small so make sure to order at least half a size up. Then you will be very happy!
customer_reviews.author: coffeelover

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: the shoes are comfortable to walk in but the right shoe feels larger than the left and I have never experienced this with other gym shoes. I walked 3 miles in them the first day and no issues with my feet. I will get an insert for the right shoe to make it feel tighter. but overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Leist

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious walkers
customer_reviews.text: While this shoe fits true to size and plenty of room in the toebox (I wear 7Wide) the shoe is not really made for serious long distance walking. I walk 4 miles per day and by mile 2, the balls of my feet are burning and bottom of toes are getting a numb/tingling feeling. Just not enough cushioning for distance walking on asphalt or concrete surfaces. Might be okay for treadmill walking or for shorter distances.
customer_reviews.author: KH avidreader

customer_reviews.title: They are made for a woman's foot.
customer_reviews.text: I like Ryka sneakers as they are fitted for women. When I get a new pair of Rykas, I don't have to break them in. They have a narrow last and fit perfectly in the heel, no blisters. I would recommend trying them.
customer_reviews.author: pw

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I have had in 11 years
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing for me. I have an autoimmune disease and it comes with plantar fasciitis and intense pain in my feet especially when I walk. These shoes are perfect for me, lots of arch support and a light shoe. I do have a high arch and these are so comfortable . I had never heard of Reka before I purchased a water shoe of theirs which I love as well. I like the fact this is a woman owned business as well.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is listed as a walking shoe, but I have used it for cross-training. It does not hold up well for a lot of side-to-side steps, but it is great for jumping, squatting, and walking. The colors are great - eye-catching without being shocking. I like the good arch support and I like that this show is a comfortable width. This is the third pair of Devotions that I have purchased, so I am a happy, repeat customer.
customer_reviews.author: mellion108

customer_reviews.title: The arch support is great and fits great
customer_reviews.text: No one seems to ever ask, BUT the beauty of this shoe in my opinion is the interior. The arch support is great and fits great, but the real beauty for me is in the heel, my ankles no longer roll when I'm walking. Mall shopping on tile floors, walking on uneven dirt regardless I'm comfortable and walk with my weight evenly distributed between my feel. It's a very secure feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Ahma

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought for work. They fit the black guidelines enough that I haven't been sent home for wearing them. They're comortable and they fit great. Bought 8.5 and they fit exactly as 8.5 should
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, padded aerobic dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear half size up then pull the laces tighter to get the right length and width. These say walking shoes, but I am now on my 5th pair over the years for aerobic dancing with lots of side to side movement and turning, Jumping.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten R.

customer_reviews.title: I hate it when people review a product they just pulled ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these shoes for almost a year. I hate it when people review a product they just pulled out of the box. After all this time I still love, love the fit and comfort of these shoes. The styling is just so so but the fit makes up for it. They are cushy but not too much that you lose stability. I highly recommend these shoes. I have worn many of the "classier" brands but for me these are my go-to pair. I would suggest ordering a 1/2 size up. I now have three pairs of RYKAs and all ran a 1/2 size small. Like walking on a cloud!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I loved these sneaks so much I bought three pairs.. about three years ago. When the last pair finally gave up the ghost, I ordered two more pairs, which came in this week. But RYKA changed the footbed and it is no longer comfortable AT ALL. It's too narrow in the front, and the "cushion" is rock hard. I am so, so disappointed and will not but these again. If you loved them before, beware: they are NOT the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to Europe. Like walking on clouds. Had bought a previous pair from the same company and had to return them, uncomfortable. but these were great! UPDATE: Stitching came out and shoe is needing repair. Will call Amazon. No shoe repair around my area ;(
customer_reviews.author: Mina Parlin Seegers

product_meta.title: RYKA Women's Devotion Sneaker
product_meta.description: Lightweight shoe engineered for hybrid training and fitness walking. The unique network of independent pods features a proprietary re-zorb active foam that works with the body’s movement to create a full body challenge in every step.
